name: raceway
content:
raceway noun [C]
(TRACK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly US a place with a track on which motor vehicles race, or the track itself: The Wisconsin International Raceway lies to the south of the city. Before the raceway closed in the 1990s, local homeowners regularly complained about the noise. The street course is known for its narrow raceway.
mainly US a wide, usually circular, path with a grass surface, on which horses race, or the area that includes this path and buildings around it: The horse placed second in its race at Raceway Park. Synonym
racetrack
More examplesFewer examplesSeason ticket holders at Phoenix International Raceway could get a lap around the one-mile oval with a professional driver.He moved from street circuits to the one-mile oval raceway at Phoenix.She said they used the road as a raceway.

raceway noun [C]
(FOR WATER)
a narrow area of water, especially one built for a particular purpose: He now has six raceways - long, water-filled concrete troughs in which the trout live. They used special paint on the raceways to control algae and make them easier to clean.
